00042 /*
00043 * Multiplexer with Waited Fair Queueing according to J.W. Roberts
00044 *
00045 * MuxWFQ mux: NINP=10, {MAXVCI=100}, OUT=line;
00046 *   // default MAXVCI: NINP
00047 *
00048 * The per-connection parameters are set by command.
00049 * Incomming cells with a VCI not yet set with SetPar() cause an error message.
00050 *
00051 * Commands
00052 * ========
00053 *  mux->SetPar(vci, delta, buff);
00054 *  // set inverse mean cell rate and buffer size for connection vci
00055 *
00056 * Other commands: as Multiplexer, see file "mux.c".
00057 *
00058 * Exportet Variables
00059 * ==================
00060 *  mux->QLenVCI(vc) // input queue length of the vc
00061 *  mux->SpacingTime // current spacing time
00062 *
00063 * WFQ Algorithm
00064 * =============
00065 * See User's manual.
00066 *
00067 * Implementation Details
00068 * ======================
00069 * For each VC, there is a structure (type wfqpar) holding the parameters
00070 * mean cell distance and queue size as well the per-VC queue itself.
00071 * The sort queue at the mux output does not contain cells, but the wfqpar
00072 * structures of those VC which currently have a cell in their queue.
00073 * Therefore the information whether a queue containes cells also says
00074 * whether this VC currently in the sort queue (used in late() where incomming
00075 * cells are put into the right queues).
00076 * When serving the output of the multiplexer, the front wfqpar struct is taken
00077 * from the sort queue, and a cell is dequeued from the associated per-VC queue.
00078 * If this queue afterwards is not yet empty, then the wfqpar struct again
00079 * is queued in the sort queue, according to the new virtual time.
00080 * The virtual time of a connection (i.e. of the first cell in the per-VC queue)
00081 * is stored in the wfqpar member time (inherited from cell).
00082 *
00083 * Since the Spacing Time is growing relatively fast, it is reset when
00084 * exceeding the constant spacTimeMax.
00085 */
00086 
00087 #include "mux.h"
00088 #include "oqueue.h"
00089 
00090 //tolua_begin
00091 class wfqpar: public ino {
00092   typedef ino baseclass;
00093  public:
00094   wfqpar(void){}
00095   ~wfqpar(void){
00096     //  printf("#2# wfqpar destruct\n");
00097   }
00098   // Derived from cell since we want to use a normal queue.
00099   // The cell member time holds the virtual time of the next cell
00100   // to be served from this VC.
00101   // The cell member vci holds the VCI of the connection, needed
00102   // in early() to update the current queue length.
00103   int vc;
00104   queue q;   // a queue per VC
00105   int delta; // inverse of mean rate of this VC
00106 };
00107 
00108 class muxWFQ: public mux {
00109   typedef mux baseclass;
00110 public:
00111   muxWFQ();
00112   ~muxWFQ();
00113   int act(void);
00114   void setQueue(int vc, wfqpar *par);
00115   wfqpar *getQueue(int vc);
00116   //tolua_end
00117   void early(event *);
00118   void late(event *);
00119   int export(exp_typ *);
00120   //tolua_begin
00121   void restim(void);
00122 
00123   tim_typ spacTime; // the central WFQ variable "Spacing Time"
00124   uoqueue sortq;  // the output sort queue
00125   //tolua_end
00126   wfqpar **partab; // per VC a data structure
00127   int *qLenVCI; // per VC: input queue length
00128   //tolua_begin
00129   enum {spacTimeMax = 100000000};
00130   // when to reset spacTime
00131 };
00132 //tolua_end
